zone.line: [f. 23r is blank]
Prometheus
Go, borne over the cities of mankind
On whirlwind-footed coursers! once again .
Outspeed the sun around the orbed world
And as thy chariot cleaves the kindling air 215
Thou breathe into the many-folded Shell
Loosening its' mighty music . . . it shall be
As thunder mingled with clear echoes — then
Return & thou shalt dwell beside our cave
Kissing the ground
And thou o Mother Earth—
The Earth
I hear—I feel—220
Thy lips are on me, & their touch runs down
Even to the adamantine central gloom
Along these marble nerves—'tis life 'tis joy
And through my withered old & icy frame
The warmth of an immortal youth shoots down
Circling — henceforth the many chlidren fair
Folded in my sustaining arms; all plants
And creeping forms, & insects rainbow-winged
And birds & beasts & fish & human shapes
Which drew disease & pain from my wan bosom
